_header: When the sun the lamp of heaven full light
Subjects: love, instructions regarding; women, praise of; commemorative verse, lovers’; lovers, praise of beloved
_description: ‘How a louer prayseth hys lady’ — 467 lines in rough doggerel couplets

BodFair16.First Lines:
WHen the son the laumpe of heuen ful lyghtPhebus with hys eye ful
                    gret round and bryght…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…Let other amende hyt that better kunneffor kunnyng in me was
                    neuer kunne
BodFair16.Note:
Last word, ‘kunne’, marked for expunction and
                    ‘nene’ added after by a later hand of 16th
                    century.
BodFair16.Attributed Title: How A Louer prayseth hys Lady (f. 306)
BodFair16.Editions:
Hammond,  Eleanor Prescott. 
             “‘How Lover Praiseth His Lady’.” 
             Modern Philology
         21 (1923-24): 379-95: 384-95.
